alert.note: Alert for Hocking; Ross (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 03 at 12:14PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by prolonged moderate rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Central Ohio and South Central Ohio, including the following counties, in Central Ohio, Hocking. In South Central Ohio, Ross. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1213 PM EST, radar indicated moderate rain pushing through the region. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible. - The rain will transition to freezing rain shortly, so only minor flooding is expected at this time. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Logan, Starr, Londonderry, Laurelville, Adelphi, South Bloomingville, Gibisonville, Richmond Dale, Union Furnace, Haydenville, Massieville and Carbon Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
